text: A small taste from bottle @ Helsinki Beer Festival 2016. Pours hazy golden with a medium head. Aroma is slightly fruity malts. Flavor is slightly sweet malts with some fruity notes. Decent.
From tap. Clear golden color with white head. Malty grainy aroma, bready, straw, grassy, herbal. Sweet and light bitter taste. Light thin to oily body with average carbonation.

14/VII/15 - 1L PET bottle from a trade @ home, Czech tasting - BB: n/a (2015-924)  Thanks to motelpogo for the trade!
Clear orange beer, no head. Aroma: very malty, bit sweet, grains, hay. MF: soft to no carbon, medium to full body. Taste: sweet malty start, grains, soft hoppiness, bit fruity. Aftertaste: nice bitter hops, citrus, grains, malts, hay, sweet, hint of caramel or fudge.

Sampled at Braukunst Live 2014, thanks to the Czechs! Hay, butterscotch earthy grassy hops
Cloudy amber, low head
Medium light body. Clay, herbal, light citrus aroma, light caramel. 
Great balance, salty finish.

UPDATED: FEB 24, 2014 1L PET bottle freshly sourced, with a cordial thanks to motelpogo and mowbeer from the enthusiastic Plzen expat delegation for the haul to Braukunst Live 02/2014, marking the millenary occasion with a much welcomed Bohemian expansion of my Pilsner vocabulary. Chalky Saaz nose, gives way to a chewy pale malt body and deliciously fragrant, peppery hops. Slightly oily, adhesive palate, adding to the rich tastes staying power like pungent mustard on fresh, buttered bread crust. Spicy, lingering finish. Sign me up for a CZ tour soon!
From tap. Pours clear and golden yellow with a small white head. Grassy and light diacetyl note. Bitter, grassy and light toasted malt. Dry bitter finish.

Draught at Bryggens Ølbar.
Clear golden coloured with a small white head.
Malty aroma of hay, hops and øllebrød.
Sweet and malty flavour of hay, grass and hops.
Dry hoppy finish.

Draft @ Bryggens Ølbar, Copenhagen. Pours a clear golden color with a small longlasting white head. Has a fruity malty grainy weak grassy hoppy aroma. Fruity malty grainy grassy hoppy flavor. Has a fruity malty grainy weak grassy hoppy finish.

Draft at 4.4%. A golden beer with a lazing white head. The aroma has notes of bread, fresh hops, spices, and malt. The flavor is sweet with notes of bread, spices, fresh hops, and malt, leading to a bitter finish.
Draught at Bryggens Ølbar. Clear golden - white head. Citrus. Orange. Light malty. Light buttery notes in the aroma. Fruity hoppt taste. Light toasted. Nice hoppy. Ok bitter finish.

Thanks to Ryan for sharing. Clear golden pour with a white head. Kind of a buttery, almost chardonnay aroma. Toast, cracker, and herbal hops. A touch of dough and grass. The flavor is moderately sweet and doughy. Bread, a bit of butter, and toast. Some grassy and herbal hops give a light bitterness on the finish.
Straight off the plane thanks to friend of GT2, hazy gold and white head, taste is a little fruity, sweet overall, good.

1L PET bottle thanks to Mowbeer! Pours a clear golden with poofy white foam. Nose is buttery, heavy cereal, pretty over the top on diacetyl moving close to a rancid dairy character. Taste is much better with butter balancing soapy/grassy Czech hops, heavy caramel and big honey. Cheerios, cereal, bread, sweet roll- lots of body to balance out the hop bite. Quenching, clean body. Very nice despite the heavy butter aroma.

Bottle (PET 2000ml): Golden, unclear, quickly collapsing loose white head, dryish chalky and peppery "Saazy" nose; pretty solid dryish bitter-sweet flavour, malty base, light to medium bodied; lingering Saaz bitter-sweet finish with chalky, again, traces. A real good Bohemian Pilsener...

(pet-bottle, 200cl) Hazy, golden colour with a blond and short foamy head. Bready cara-malty aroma with buttery and fruity notes, accompanied by herbal and slightly woody hops. Mildly sweet and bitter flavour, light to medium bodied with a tame carbonation. Cara-malty, bready and buttery taste with subtle fruity notes and a balanced and present hops character; almost dry bitter hoppy and slightly sweet malty finish. A well-crafted Pilsener. 19.VIII.12

2l PETka from the brewer. Hazy golden colour, mid-sized white head. Lovely Czech aroma. Superb malty base with lots of Saaz hops. Bitter-sweet, elegant malt body. Highly aromatic and highly drinkable beer - a delicious and very Czech lager. Anytime again!

UPDATED: SEP 25, 2012 Drafted at klub malych pivovaru in Pilsen.Slightly hazy golden color proper foamy head.Scents of rose petals,flower garden,fresh grain,peach,hay,grass,coffee house,roasty,soil,tastes of,plant stems,cough syrup,fresh saaz hops,cereal,grain,roasted malt,almost burnt toast,grass,peach.This is how a lager should taste.The best Czech lager Ive ever had and ive tried most of them.

on tap at the brewery in stahlavy, a fantastic biergarten incidentally. anyways, faintly hazed rich golden with a substantial head. aroma bursting with freshly-mown grass, peach nectar; loads of flavour - juicy saaz, rusty tea, grassy, menthol. well worth a visit to this charmingly ramshackle operation
Bottle from brewery. Hazy golden cor with huge white head. Aroma of grain, milk, butter. Taste, fruity, grainy, some malty hints, bittersweet finish. Drinkable.
